title: Mass Effect Andromeda release date finally confirmed for March
text:
Mass Effect Andromeda release date finally confirmed for March Written in the stars. By Tom Phillips Published 04/01/2017 
After years of waiting, Mass Effect Andromeda finally has a release date: 23rd March in Europe and 21st March in North America. 
The date was announced alongside a new trailer during the opening keynote of CES 2017 (Consumer Electronics Show), held in Las Vegas. 
Andromeda is the fourth main game in BioWare's sci-fi series and has been in development for nearly five years. We've been seeing bits and pieces of it for a while, but the game's marketing has only really kicked into gear in the last couple of months. 
Gameplay footage first appeared at September's PlayStation Pro event, followed by further at December's Game Awards and PlayStation Meeting. 
We know have a good idea when Mass Effect Andromeda is set , who the major characters are and who (most) of your squadmates will be . 
It's been a long wait for Mass Effect Andromeda's release date - and it's strange EA has made us wait this long - but BioWare seemed confident of the game's prospects when Eurogamer sat down for a interview last month. Our chat detailed Mass Effect Andromeda's squadmates, cut content and the game's final round of polish .
